Declaration of S. Korean students organization
articles.content:
Declaration of S. Korean students organization 
    Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The southern Seoul district federation of university student councils reportedly issued a declaration of its 10th-term inauguration on may 28.
 In the declaration the federation said that students have long waged a dynamic struggle for independence, democracy and reunification. It would carry out the tasks for complete independence of campus and national reunification without fail this year, the declaration noted, and pointed out:    
 Youth and students are duty-bound to open a decisive phase of national reunification. the federation will implement it in the van.

articles.title: Chief of KPA general staff meets Russian military delegation
articles.content:
Chief of KPA general staff meets Russian military delegation 
    Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA)-- Vice marshal Kim Yong Chun, chief of the general staff of the Korean People's Army met and had a talk in a friendly atmosphere yesterday with the delegation of the far eastern military district of the federal armed forces of Russia led by colonel general Yuri Yakubov, commander of the district.
 Present there were colonel general Pak Sung Won and other generals and officers of the KPA and Vladislav Prokopenko, military attache of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: British charge d'affaires hosts reception
articles.content:
British charge d'affaires hosts reception 
    Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- James Edward Hoare, charge d'affaires ad interim of the UK in Pyongyang, hosted a reception on an excursion boat in the River Taedong on June 1 to celebrate the birthday of the queen of the UK (National Day).
 Present on invitation were Ri Kwang Gun, minister of foreign trade, Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of foreign affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairman of the DPRK committee for friendship with the British people, Ri Yong Sok, vice-chairman of the DPRK Flood Damage Rehabilitation Committee, and officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys, representatives of the international organizations and staff members of embassies here.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

SPA chairman meets Tajik delegation
